00022 #ifndef _BROAD_ESTEPPER1_H
00023 #define _BROAD_ESTEPPER1_H
00024 
00025 #include "canary/CanaryOptions.h"
00026 #include "canary/CanaryPrior.h"
00027 //
00028 #include "newmat.h"
00029 //
00030 #include <valarray>
00031 #include <vector>
00032 //
00033 
00034 /// Translation from R to C++ of the Broad's expectation step
00035 /** Expectation step from the R mclust package translated to C++ for the
00036     case of spherical clusters.  Updating of all parameters according to
00037     Canary from Birdsuite version 1.3.  For a set of points, each model
00038     in the model selection scheme will require a BroadEstepper1 instance.
00039     General idea is to use an instance to update parameter estimates
00040     by executing the member update_broad().
00041  */
00042 
00043 class BroadEstepper1 {
00044 public:
00045 /// Constructor
00046 /** @param opts stores program execution options, defaults and derived options.
00047     @param vals_in holds the data points to cluster
00048     @param prior_in contains prior cluster information
00049     @clusters_in numeric cluster labels for the model
00050  */
00051 
00052   BroadEstepper1(CanaryOptions& opts,
00053                  valarray<double> vals_in,
00054                  CanaryPrior & prior_in,
00055                  vector<int> & clusters_in);
00056 
00057   /// Default constructor
00058   BroadEstepper1(CanaryOptions& opts);
00059 
00060   /// Copy constructor
00061   BroadEstepper1(const BroadEstepper1 & BE);
00062 
00063   /// Assignment
00064   BroadEstepper1 & operator=(const BroadEstepper1 & BE);
00065 
00066   /// @return copy of the data
00067   valarray<double> vals() { return _vals; }
00068 
00069   /// @return copy of the prior
00070   CanaryPrior prior() { return _prior; }
00071 
00072   /// @return numeric cluster labels
00073   vector<int> cvec() { return _cvec; }
00074 
00075   /// @return copy of the proportions of cluster memberships
00076   valarray<double> prop() { return _prop; }
00077 
00078   /// @return value of kth member of cluster memberships
00079   double prop(int k) { return _prop[k]; }
00080 
00081   /// Breaks encapsulation to assign proportions of cluster memberships
00082   void prop(valarray<double> prop_in) { _prop = prop_in; }
00083 
00084   /// @return copy of cluster means
00085   valarray<double> mean() { return _mean; }
00086 
00087   /// @return value of kth cluster mean
00088   double mean(int k) { return _mean[k]; }
00089 
00090   /// Breaks encapsulation to assign cluster means
00091   void mean(valarray<double> mean_in) { _mean = mean_in; }
00092 
00093   /// @return copy of cluster variances
00094   valarray<double> var() { return _var; }
00095 
00096   /// @return value of kth cluster variance
00097   double var(int k) { return _var[k]; }
00098 
00099   /// Breaks encapsulation to assign cluster variances
00100   void var(valarray<double> var_in) { _var = var_in; }
00101 
00102   /// @return matrix of probabilities of cluster memberships
00103   /** (row,col) <=> (i,j) <=> (sample,cluster)
00104       probability that sample i belongs to cluster j
00105    */
00106   Matrix prob() { return _prob; }
00107 
00108 //herehere
00109   void update_broad();
00110   void update_prop_broad();
00111   void update_mean_broad();
00112   void update_var_broad();
00113   void update_prob();
00114   double log_likelihood();
00115   vector<double> confidences();
00116   vector<int> assignments();
00117 
00118 private:
00119   unsigned long N;
00120   unsigned long G;
00121   valarray<double>_vals;
00122   CanaryPrior _prior;
00123   vector<int> _cvec;
00124   valarray<double> _prop;
00125   valarray<double> _mean;
00126   valarray<double> _var;
00127   Matrix _prob;
00128   CanaryOptions& _opts;
00129 };
00130 
00131 #endif
